text: Craigroyston Community High School is a non-denominational community secondary school in Edinburgh. The headteacher is Shelley McLaren. ==History== Plans for the high school were originally drawn up in 1959 with the school opening in April 1963. A new building was opened in 2010 by Sir Tom Farmer. ==Notable Former Students== * Sheila Begbie – Director of Domestic Rugby at the Scottish Rugby Union and former footballer * Gordon Strachan - Football manager and former player ==References== ==External links== *Craigroyston Community High School Category:Secondary schools in Edinburgh Category:Educational institutions established in 1963 Category:1963 establishments in Scotland
title: Craigroyston Community High School
